// Do not edit this file as it will be overwritten if HAMR codegen is rerun

object Temperature_i {
  def example(): Data_Invariants.Temperature_i = {
    return Data_Invariants.Temperature_i(
      degrees = Base_Types.Float_64_example())
  }

  /** invariant i1
    *   Temperature Data Invariant
    */
  @strictpure def i1_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    value.degrees >= -459.67d

  /** invariant i2
    *   V: real vs neg real
    */
  @strictpure def i2_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    1.0d >= -459.67d

  /** invariant i3
    *   V: comparing ints
    */
  @strictpure def i3_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    1 + 1 <= 3 - 1

  /** invariant i4
    *   V: T
    */
  @strictpure def i4_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    T

  /** invariant i5
    *   V: !F
    */
  @strictpure def i5_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    !F

  /** invariant i6
    *   V: mixed
    */
  @strictpure def i6_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    F != (1 + 1 <= 3 - 1)

  /** invariant i7
    *   V: logical ops
    */
  @strictpure def i7_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    T | T ||
      T & !T &&
        T

  /** invariant i8
    *   V: arith ops
    */
  @strictpure def i8_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    2 - 1 - 5 / 5 + 1 * 5 == 5

  /** invariant i9
    *   litInters
    */
  @strictpure def i9_Invariant(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    1 > 0 &&
      z8"8" > z8"7" &&
      z16"16" > z16"15" &&
      z32"32" > z32"31" &&
      z64"64" > z64"63" &&
      n"1" > n"0" &&
      n8"8" > n8"7" &&
      n16"16" > n16"15" &&
      n32"32" > n32"31" &&
      n64"64" > n64"63" &&
      s8"9" > s8"8" &&
      s16"16" > s16"15" &&
      s32"32" > s32"31" &&
      s64"64" > s64"63" &&
      u1"1" > u1"0" &&
      u2"1" > u2"0" &&
      u3"1" > u3"0" &&
      u4"1" > u4"0" &&
      u5"1" > u5"0" &&
      u6"1" > u6"0" &&
      u7"1" > u7"0" &&
      u8"1" > u8"0" &&
      u9"1" > u9"0" &&
      u10"1" > u10"0" &&
      u11"1" > u11"0" &&
      u12"1" > u12"0" &&
      u13"1" > u13"0" &&
      u14"1" > u14"0" &&
      u15"1" > u15"0" &&
      u16"1" > u16"0" &&
      u17"1" > u17"0" &&
      u18"1" > u18"0" &&
      u19"1" > u19"0" &&
      u20"1" > u20"0" &&
      u21"1" > u21"0" &&
      u22"1" > u22"0" &&
      u23"1" > u23"0" &&
      u24"1" > u24"0" &&
      u25"1" > u25"0" &&
      u26"1" > u26"0" &&
      u27"1" > u27"0" &&
      u28"1" > u28"0" &&
      u29"1" > u29"0" &&
      u30"1" > u30"0" &&
      u31"1" > u31"0" &&
      u32"1" > u32"0" &&
      u33"1" > u33"0" &&
      u34"1" > u34"0" &&
      u35"1" > u35"0" &&
      u36"1" > u36"0" &&
      u37"1" > u37"0" &&
      u38"1" > u38"0" &&
      u39"1" > u39"0" &&
      u40"1" > u40"0" &&
      u41"1" > u41"0" &&
      u42"1" > u42"0" &&
      u43"1" > u43"0" &&
      u44"1" > u44"0" &&
      u45"1" > u45"0" &&
      u46"1" > u46"0" &&
      u47"1" > u47"0" &&
      u48"1" > u48"0" &&
      u49"1" > u49"0" &&
      u50"1" > u50"0" &&
      u51"1" > u51"0" &&
      u52"1" > u52"0" &&
      u53"1" > u53"0" &&
      u54"1" > u54"0" &&
      u55"1" > u55"0" &&
      u56"1" > u56"0" &&
      u57"1" > u57"0" &&
      u58"1" > u58"0" &&
      u59"1" > u59"0" &&
      u60"1" > u60"0" &&
      u61"1" > u61"0" &&
      u62"1" > u62"0" &&
      u63"1" > u63"0" &&
      u64"1" > u64"0" &&
      1.0f > 0.0f &&
      1.0d > 0.0d &&
      r"1.0" > r"0.0" &&
      "bbbbb" != "aaaaa" &&
      -1.0f == -1.0f

  /** D-Inv Data Invariant for Data_Invariants.Temperature_i
    */
  @strictpure def D_Inv_Temperature_i(value: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    (i1_Invariant(value) &
     i2_Invariant(value) &
     i3_Invariant(value) &
     i4_Invariant(value) &
     i5_Invariant(value) &
     i6_Invariant(value) &
     i7_Invariant(value) &
     i8_Invariant(value) &
     i9_Invariant(value))

  /** D-Inv-Guard Data Invariant for Data_Invariants.Temperature_i
    */
  @strictpure def D_Inv_Guard_Temperature_i(value: Option[Data_Invariants.Temperature_i]): B =
    value.nonEmpty -->: D_Inv_Temperature_i(value.get)
}

@datatype class Temperature_i(
  val degrees: F64) {
  @spec def i1 = Invariant(
    degrees >= -459.67d
  )

  @spec def i2 = Invariant(
    1.0d >= -459.67d
  )

  @spec def i3 = Invariant(
    1 + 1 <= 3 - 1
  )

  @spec def i4 = Invariant(
    T
  )

  @spec def i5 = Invariant(
    !F
  )

  @spec def i6 = Invariant(
    F != (1 + 1 <= 3 - 1)
  )

  @spec def i7 = Invariant(
    T | T ||
      T & !T &&
        T
  )

  @spec def i8 = Invariant(
    2 - 1 - 5 / 5 + 1 * 5 == 5
  )

  @spec def i9 = Invariant(
    1 > 0 &&
      z8"8" > z8"7" &&
      z16"16" > z16"15" &&
      z32"32" > z32"31" &&
      z64"64" > z64"63" &&
      n"1" > n"0" &&
      n8"8" > n8"7" &&
      n16"16" > n16"15" &&
      n32"32" > n32"31" &&
      n64"64" > n64"63" &&
      s8"9" > s8"8" &&
      s16"16" > s16"15" &&
      s32"32" > s32"31" &&
      s64"64" > s64"63" &&
      u1"1" > u1"0" &&
      u2"1" > u2"0" &&
      u3"1" > u3"0" &&
      u4"1" > u4"0" &&
      u5"1" > u5"0" &&
      u6"1" > u6"0" &&
      u7"1" > u7"0" &&
      u8"1" > u8"0" &&
      u9"1" > u9"0" &&
      u10"1" > u10"0" &&
      u11"1" > u11"0" &&
      u12"1" > u12"0" &&
      u13"1" > u13"0" &&
      u14"1" > u14"0" &&
      u15"1" > u15"0" &&
      u16"1" > u16"0" &&
      u17"1" > u17"0" &&
      u18"1" > u18"0" &&
      u19"1" > u19"0" &&
      u20"1" > u20"0" &&
      u21"1" > u21"0" &&
      u22"1" > u22"0" &&
      u23"1" > u23"0" &&
      u24"1" > u24"0" &&
      u25"1" > u25"0" &&
      u26"1" > u26"0" &&
      u27"1" > u27"0" &&
      u28"1" > u28"0" &&
      u29"1" > u29"0" &&
      u30"1" > u30"0" &&
      u31"1" > u31"0" &&
      u32"1" > u32"0" &&
      u33"1" > u33"0" &&
      u34"1" > u34"0" &&
      u35"1" > u35"0" &&
      u36"1" > u36"0" &&
      u37"1" > u37"0" &&
      u38"1" > u38"0" &&
      u39"1" > u39"0" &&
      u40"1" > u40"0" &&
      u41"1" > u41"0" &&
      u42"1" > u42"0" &&
      u43"1" > u43"0" &&
      u44"1" > u44"0" &&
      u45"1" > u45"0" &&
      u46"1" > u46"0" &&
      u47"1" > u47"0" &&
      u48"1" > u48"0" &&
      u49"1" > u49"0" &&
      u50"1" > u50"0" &&
      u51"1" > u51"0" &&
      u52"1" > u52"0" &&
      u53"1" > u53"0" &&
      u54"1" > u54"0" &&
      u55"1" > u55"0" &&
      u56"1" > u56"0" &&
      u57"1" > u57"0" &&
      u58"1" > u58"0" &&
      u59"1" > u59"0" &&
      u60"1" > u60"0" &&
      u61"1" > u61"0" &&
      u62"1" > u62"0" &&
      u63"1" > u63"0" &&
      u64"1" > u64"0" &&
      1.0f > 0.0f &&
      1.0d > 0.0d &&
      r"1.0" > r"0.0" &&
      "bbbbb" != "aaaaa" &&
      -1.0f == -1.0f
  )
}

object Temperature_i_Payload {
  def example(): Temperature_i_Payload = {
    return Temperature_i_Payload(Data_Invariants.Temperature_i.example())

package data_invariants__JVM.Data_Invariants

// Do not edit this file as it will be overwritten if HAMR codegen is rerun
object t_p_t_GumboX {
  /** IEP-Post: Initialize Entrypoint Post-Condition
    *
    * @param api_setPoint outgoing data port
    * @param api_temp outgoing data port
    */
  @strictpure def inititialize_IEP_Post (
      api_setPoint: Data_Invariants.SetPoint_i,
      api_temp: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    (// D-Inv-Guard: Datatype invariants for the types associated with t's state variables and outgoing ports
     Data_Invariants.SetPoint_i.D_Inv_SetPoint_i(api_setPoint) &
     Data_Invariants.Temperature_i.D_Inv_Temperature_i(api_temp))

  /** IEP-Post: Initialize Entrypoint Post-Condition via container
    *
    * @param post Container holding the value of incoming ports and the pre-state values of state variables
    */
  @strictpure def inititialize_IEP_Post_Container (post: t_p_t_PostState_Container_PS): B =
    inititialize_IEP_Post (
      api_setPoint = post.api_setPoint,
      api_temp = post.api_temp)

  /** CEP-Post: Compute Entrypoint Post-Condition for t
    *
    * @param api_setPoint outgoing data port
    * @param api_temp outgoing data port
    */
  @strictpure def compute_CEP_Post (
      api_setPoint: Data_Invariants.SetPoint_i,
      api_temp: Data_Invariants.Temperature_i): B =
    (// D-Inv-Guard: Datatype invariants for the types associated with t's state variables and outgoing ports
     Data_Invariants.SetPoint_i.D_Inv_SetPoint_i(api_setPoint) & 
     Data_Invariants.Temperature_i.D_Inv_Temperature_i(api_temp))

  /** CEP-Post: Compute Entrypoint Post-Condition for t via containers
    *
    * @param pre Container holding the values of incoming ports and the pre-state values of state variables
    * @param post Container holding the values of outgoing ports and the post-state values of state variables
    */
  @strictpure def compute_CEP_Post_Container(
      pre: t_p_t_PreState_Container_PS,
      post: t_p_t_PostState_Container_PS): B =
    compute_CEP_Post(
      api_setPoint = post.api_setPoint,
      api_temp = post.api_temp)
}

// #Sireum

package art

import org.sireum._
import art.scheduling.Scheduler

@ext object ArtNative {

  def shouldDispatch(bridgeId: Art.BridgeId): B = $

  def dispatchStatus(bridgeId: Art.BridgeId): DispatchStatus = $


  def receiveInput(eventPortIds: ISZ[Art.PortId], dataPortIds: ISZ[Art.PortId]): Unit = $

  def putValue(portId: Art.PortId, data: DataContent): Unit = $

  def getValue(portId: Art.PortId): Option[DataContent] = $

  def sendOutput(eventPortIds: ISZ[Art.PortId], dataPortIds: ISZ[Art.PortId]): Unit = $


  def logInfo(title: String, msg: String): Unit = $

  def logError(title: String, msg: String): Unit = $

  def logDebug(title: String, msg: String): Unit = $


  def tearDownSystemState(): Unit = $

  def setUpSystemState(): Unit = $

  // JH: Refactor
  def initializePhase(): Unit = $

  // JH: Refactor
  def computePhase(): Unit = $

  // JH: Refactor
  def finalizePhase(): Unit = $

  def time(): Art.Time = $

  /////////////
  // TESTING //
  /////////////

  /**
   * Calls the initialize entry points on all registered bridges.
   *
   * An analogue to this method does not show up in developer-written unit tests because
   * the it's invoked behind the scenes by the automatically generated unit test infrastructure
   * as a prelude to each test.
   *
   */
  def initTest(bridge: Bridge): Unit = $

  /**
   * Executes the application code in the Initialize Entry Point for the component (identified
   * by given bridge) for the purposes of testing.
   *
   * Precondition: testInit() has been called prior.
   *
   * Unlike [[Art.run()]], this method does NOT wrap compute calls in a try-catch block.
   * This is to ensure no exceptions are overlooked during testing.
  */
  def testInitialise(bridge: Bridge): Unit = $

  /**
   * Executes the application code in the Compute Entry Point for the component (identified
   * by given bridge) for the purposes of testing.
   *
   * Precondition: initTest() has been called prior.
   *
   * Unlike [[Art.run()]], this method does NOT wrap compute calls in a try-catch block.
   * This is to ensure no exceptions are overlooked during testing.
   */
  def testCompute(bridge: Bridge): Unit = $

  /**
   * Calls the finalize entry points on all registered bridges.
   *
   * An analogue to this method does not show up in developer-written unit tests because
   * the it's invoked behind the scenes by the automatically generated unit test infrastructure
   * as a postlude to each test.
   */
  def finalizeTest(bridge: Bridge): Unit = $

  // JH: Refactored
  //   add system test capability
  def initSystemTest(scheduler: Scheduler): Unit = $

  //  def executeSystemTest(): Unit = $

  // JH: Refactored
  //   add system test capability
  def finalizeSystemTest(): Unit = $

  /**
   * A method that replaces bridge.compute()'s calls to [[Art.sendOutput()]] in its equivalent testCompute() method.
   *
   * This method is currently a NO-OP, but may gain functionality later.
   *
   * @param eventPortIds the event ports to be "copied and cleared" (but currently nothing happens)
   * @param dataPortIds the data ports to be "copied and cleared" (but currently nothing happens)
   */
  def releaseOutput(eventPortIds: ISZ[Art.PortId], dataPortIds: ISZ[Art.PortId]): Unit = $

  /**
   * Because a bridge's testCompute() doesn't clear outputs, this method can be used by users to manually
   * clear the output if desired. This is useful for tests involving multiple dispatches.
   */
  def manuallyClearOutput(): Unit = $

  /**
   * Inserts a value into an "infrastructure in" port. For testing only, normally this is handled by Art.
   *
   * @param dstPortId the portId to place the passed [[DataContent]] into
   * @param data the [[DataContent]] which will be placed in the dstPort
   */
  def insertInInfrastructurePort(dstPortId: Art.PortId, data: DataContent): Unit = $

  /**
   * Returns the value of an infrastructure in port.
   *
   * @param portId the id of the INPUT infrastructure port to return a value from
   * @return If the port is non-empty, a [[Some]] of [[DataContent]]. Otherwise [[None]].
   */
  def observeInInfrastructurePort(portId: Art.PortId): Option[DataContent] = $

  /**
   * Returns the value of an infrastructure out port.
   *
   * @param portId the id of the OUTPUT port to return a value from
   * @return If the port is non-empty, a [[Some]] of [[DataContent]]. Otherwise [[None]].
   */
  def observeOutInfrastructurePort(portId: Art.PortId): Option[DataContent] = $

  /**
     * Returns the value of an application in port.
     *
     * @param portId the id of the INPUT port to return a value from
     * @return If the port is non-empty, a [[Some]] of [[DataContent]]. Otherwise [[None]].
     */
  def observeInPortVariable(portId: Art.PortId): Option[DataContent] = $

  /**
     * Returns the value of an application out port.
     *
     * @param portId the id of the OUTPUT port to return a value from
     * @return If the port is non-empty, a [[Some]] of [[DataContent]]. Otherwise [[None]].
     */
  def observeOutPortVariable(portId: Art.PortId): Option[DataContent] = $
}

:BOF

  echo Please set SIREUM_HOME env var
  exit /B -1
)

exit /B %errorlevel%
::!#*/
// #Sireum

import org.sireum._

val sireum = Os.path(Os.env("SIREUM_HOME").get) / "bin" / (if (Os.isWin) "sireum.bat" else "sireum")

// Do not edit this file as it will be overwritten if HAMR codegen is rerun

// create serializers/deserializers for the Slang types used in the project

val files: ISZ[String] = ISZ("../src/main/data/data_invariants__JVM/Data_Invariants/Temperature_i.scala",
                             "../src/main/data/data_invariants__JVM/Data_Invariants/SetPoint_i.scala",
                             "../src/main/data/data_invariants__JVM/Base_Types.scala",
                             "../src/main/data/data_invariants__JVM/Data_Invariants/t_p_t__Containers.scala",
                             "../src/main/art/art/DataContent.scala",
                             "../src/main/data/data_invariants__JVM/Aux_Types.scala")

val toolargs: String = st"${(files, " ")}".render

proc"$sireum tools sergen -p data_invariants__JVM -m json,msgpack -o ${Os.slashDir.up}/src/main/data/data_invariants__JVM $toolargs".at(Os.slashDir).console.runCheck()

import org.sireum._
